user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of spinlock:
```c
static int spinlock(void)
{
	struct metal_spinlock lock = METAL_SPINLOCK_INIT;
	const int threads = 10;
	int value, error;

	error = metal_run(threads, spinlock_thread, &lock);
	if (!error) {
		value = total;
		value -= spinlock_test_count * threads;
		if (value) {
			metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "counter mismatch, delta = %d\n",
				  value);
			error = -EINVAL;
		}
	}

	return error;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function spinlock:
int metal_run(int threads, metal_thread_t child, void *arg)
{
	pthread_t tids[threads];
	int error, ts_created;

	error = metal_run_noblock(threads, child, arg, tids, &ts_created);

	metal_finish_threads(ts_created, (void *)tids);

	return error;
}
...
static void *spinlock_thread(void *arg)
{
	struct metal_spinlock *l = arg;
	int i;

	for (i = 0; i < spinlock_test_count; i++) {
		metal_spinlock_acquire(l);
		total++;
		metal_spinlock_release(l);
	}

	return NULL;
}
...
static unsigned int total = 0
...
static const int spinlock_test_count = 1000
...
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
static void *spinlock_thread(void *arg)
{
	struct metal_spinlock *l = arg;
	int i;

	for (i = 0; i < spinlock_test_count; i++) {
		metal_spinlock_acquire(l);
		total++;
		metal_spinlock_release(l);
	}

	return NULL;
}

```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The function spinlock_thread contains no unreachable code: the for-loop executes spinlock_test_count times and then the function returns NULL. A concrete violation scenario would be, for example, placing statements after an unconditional return or after an infinite loop (e.g. code following 'return NULL;' or code after 'for(;;) { return; }'), which would be unreachable.
